Pre-Game Insights: Both teams have been in decent form ahead of this clash with England playing a tough series against the West Indies and then dominating Pakistan at home.
Scotland played a couple of warm-up games of which one was washed out and the other resulted in a defeat.
Before the World Cup practice games, Scotland finished second in the tri-series against the Netherlands and Ireland.
England kicks off the tournament as the defending champion and the favourites with a stacked squad of quality players.
The Three Lions boast of one of the best batting lineups in the world led by captain Jos Buttler, who has found form at the right time with aggressive batters around him.
Jofra Archer’s return has given the side a massive boost.
Scotland has been one of the most exciting associate teams in the world and made consistent improvements over the years.
Southpaw George Munsey will be the lynchpin of Scotland's batting lineup with an aggressive style and incredible ability to score quickly against spin.
Mark Watt, the left-arm spinner, will be crucial with his change of pace and a trademark 24-yard ball, which could dominate in the spin-friendly conditions of the Caribbean.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will take place on June 4, 2024, at 8:00 PM IST at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown.
Live ball-by-ball commentary will be available on SportsTiger.
